Yajush Gupta
October 29, 2024

SMEs are turning to marketing automation to save time, improve customer engagement, and boost revenue. This Tech Tuesday, we spotlight top marketing automation solutions designed to streamline campaigns, nurture leads, and free up valuable hours for growing your business.

Digibot is an AI-powered chatbot designed to revolutionise customer support by offering personalised, 24/7 assistance that integrates seamlessly with a business’s data. Utilising AI, Digibot provides instant, data-driven responses to customer inquiries, eliminating wait times and enhancing user engagement. Its scalable design ensures that whether a business receives a few or thousands of inquiries, Digibot can handle them all without compromising service quality.

Digibot is set to disrupt the customer service industry, offering businesses in e-commerce, professional services, and beyond the ability to optimise operations, boost conversions, and reduce operational costs. Launched commercially in 2024, Digibot has become an invaluable tool for businesses looking to scale efficiently and provide exceptional customer experiences.

impact.com’s partnership automation platform has democratised the ability of brands of all sizes to create an incremental revenue stream from partnerships without requiring additional headcount. It offers SME’s the ability to manage and scale affiliate, influencer, referral marketing and brand and publisher partnerships in one centralised platform, eliminating the need for cumbersome manual processes.
It automates the complex processes involved in managing partnerships, from recruitment and contracting to payment, optimisation, and reporting, supporting over 40 languages and 130 currencies.

Thryv, an all-encompassing software platform designed for small businesses, is revolutionizing the way owners manage and grow their companies by streamlining everyday operations in one place. Trusted by over 85,000 small businesses, Thryv has become a game-changer in efficiency, helping users save up to 20 hours per week through automation. With a suite of powerful marketing tools, Thryv simplifies essential tasks for business owners. Key features include:

Intuit Mailchimp’s new Revenue Intelligence (RI) system is designed to simplify marketing automation for companies of all sizes by leveraging AI and data analytics. The system automates the process of turning data into actionable insights, helping businesses optimise their marketing efforts without manual intervention. With predictive models based on financial and performance data from Intuit’s ecosystem, the tool identifies the best time to target customers, automates personalised email and SMS content generation, and suggests strategies to maximise engagement and revenue.

SMEs can visualise their entire marketing funnel and track key metrics like customer lifetime value, helping them make smarter decisions with minimal effort. By automating these complex tasks, Revenue Intelligence allows SMEs to focus on growth while the tool handles the heavy lifting of data analysis and content optimisation, driving efficiency and results.

HubSpot offers a comprehensive marketing automation platform designed to help SMEs scale their marketing efforts with ease. Known for its intuitive interface and strong customer support, HubSpot covers email marketing, lead tracking, social media, and more. HubSpot’s scalable pricing and feature-rich options make it an ideal choice for businesses that want to grow, while its CRM integration makes it easy to manage customer relationships.

ActiveCampaign is known for its powerful automation tools that provide SMEs with advanced email marketing, lead scoring, and customer journey mapping, allowing for highly personalized and data-driven campaigns. With a robust set of integrations and flexible automation workflows, ActiveCampaign allows SMEs to build complex, personalized marketing paths without requiring extensive technical knowledge.
